intro: Cerastium latifolium var. compactum, commonly known as the compact snowdrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe. It features dense clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has succulent, hairy leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or rocky crevices. Its compact growth habit makes it an attractive and hardy ground cover for garden settings.
